Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that a bomb blast occurred at the South African embassy in Nigeria.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that neither the South African high commission nor the consulate-general in Nigeria have been hit by a bomb attack during the recent unrest.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the video showing a bomb blast is related to the South African embassy in Nigeria, despite evidence suggesting it is from a different incident.
Exist alternative explanation: The Nigerian government and police force provide an alternative explanation, stating that the video is from a bombing in Abuja in 2014, not from an attack on the South African embassy.
Understate: The claim may understate the seriousness of the situation by falsely attributing a bomb blast to the South African embassy, potentially causing unnecessary panic or fear.
Exaggerate: There is no evidence of exaggeration in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by not providing enough evidence or accurate information to support its assertion of a bomb blast at the South African embassy.
